newsitem.title: AZERBAIJAN: French foreign minister meets Azeri president.
newsitem.headline: French foreign minister meets Azeri president.

text.p: French Foreign Minister Herve de Charette met Azeri President Haydar Aliyev on Tuesday during a brief visit aimed at advancing negotiations over the country's territorial conflict with neighbouring Armenia.
De Charette told reporters before the meeting: "France wants a settlement based on international principles."

An Azeri Foreign Ministry spokesman said the talks would focus on the nine-year conflict between Moslem Azerbaijan and Christian Armenia over the disputed enclave of Nagorno-Karabakh, whose ethnic Armenian population broke away from Azeri rule in the late 1980s.
Aliyev said he welcomed the commitment to a settlement from Paris, which is a co-sponsor of peace talks under the auspices of the Organisation for Security and Cooperation in Europe.
De Charette was due to fly on to the Armenian capital Yerevan later in the evening, where he will meet President Levon Ter-Petrosyan on Wednesday, officials said.
The latest round of negotiations between Azeri and Armenian representatives began on Tuesday in Moscow.
Their conflict over Nagorno-Karabakh killed thousands until a ceasefire came into effect in 1994 but no lasting settlement has been achieved.
